channel.title: More Spanning Tree - David Vargas
channel.description: Spanning Tree Protocol Prevents loops in a network. Loops can create Broadcast storms, Mac table instability, and Multiple frame transmission. Broadcast Storms Switch receives a broadcast frame. Switch transmits that frame out of all ports. The broadcast frames will keep being received on each switch then broadcasted again. Mac Table instability Broadcast storm is causing broadcast packets going in and out of every port, the Switch has to keep updating the source mac address of those packets.
